definition: loose/to loosen/to relax/floss (dry, fluffy food product made from shredded, seasoned meat or fish, used as a topping or filling)
scattered/loose/to come loose/to fall apart/leisurely/powdered medicine
to scatter/to break up (a meeting etc)/to disperse/to disseminate/to dispel/(coll.) to sack

sentences.english: When the coils come off the winding machine, they are fairly loose, and delicate.
sentences.chinese: 當線圈脫落的纏繞機，它們是相當鬆散的，而微妙的。

sentences.english: Her long black hair hung loosely about her shoulders .
sentences.chinese: 她那長長的黑髮鬆散地飄垂在雙肩上。

sentences.english: Birch trees are loosely spread throughout the zone as a whole.
sentences.chinese: 樺樹鬆散地分散在整個區域。

sentences.english: She stands in the ruins, hair loose and paralyzed, awaiting her punishment.
sentences.chinese: 她站在廢墟里，頭髮鬆散蓬亂，等待着對她的懲罰。

sentences.english: Loose collections of these ices and small rocky particles form into comets.
sentences.chinese: 這些冰和小巖體鬆散地組合形成彗星。

sentences.english: My hair is that long and shining, which memorizing every story that I have been through.
sentences.chinese: 頭髮鬆鬆散散依然光澤，紀錄着這些年的故事。

sentences.english: The tumor is bright yellow and grossly resembles zona fasciculata seen in the specimen.
sentences.chinese: 在標本中腫瘤呈明黃色並且類似鬆散的束狀帶。

sentences.english: Now, instead of marching as one, we were ready to get loose.
sentences.chinese: 現在，沒有了整齊劃一的行進，隊伍開始變得鬆散了。

sentences.english: It's loose plot spoils the novel.
sentences.chinese: 情節鬆散使這篇小說大爲減色。

sentences.english: Long with a loose top small white pompon .
sentences.chinese: 頂端長着一個鬆散的小白絨球。

sentences.english: After a while, loose alliances began to emerge.
sentences.chinese: 過了一會，鬆散的聯盟開始出現。

sentences.english: Leaves turned to be crisp and the whole bunch of flowers turned to be thinner than what they original looked like.
sentences.chinese: 葉子已經變幹，整束花看上去比原來鬆散了好多。

sentences.english: However, the loose, it should bethe new out of the AN.
sentences.chinese: 但是最鬆散的，應該就是新出的AN了。

sentences.english: Even celery has been loosely linked to mental acuity.
sentences.chinese: 甚至芹菜已經被鬆散地與腦力敏銳度聯繫在一起。

sentences.english: Working floors must be kept clear of obstructions and loose grit.
sentences.chinese: 作業地面必須隨時清除障礙物和鬆散的粗砂。

sentences.english: They played too loosely. I never saw them set up perfectly.
sentences.chinese: 他們打得太鬆散了，我從沒看到他們墊球墊得完美過。

definition: to be nothing to write home about (idiom)
to control/to curb/to restrict/to impede/to pin down (enemy troops)
many and complicated/mired in minor details
to be at the scene (sitting for an exam, performing, competing, giving directions etc)/firsthand (experience)/impromptu (remarks etc)
to change (sth)/to alter (sth)/to change over (to sth else)
